frameDefinitions: An Item is located on a Scale relative to a critical value which is determined by some Enabled_situation.
An Agent initiates the beginning of an ongoing Activity in which he will be continuously involved. '' 'At the same time, city-states began to grow in influence on the southern Greek mainland.'
A Payer gives up (or potentially gives up) the use of an Asset (generally money) in order to achieve an Intended_event.
An Entity is declared to exist, generally irrespective of its position or even the possibility of its position being specified.
An Experiencer has an easy or difficult time carrying out an Activity.
A Dependent state-of-affairs has a Requirement as a prerequisite for obtaining or occurring.
frameExamples: At the same time, city-states <t>began</t> to grow in influence on the southern Greek mainland.
It 'll <t>cost</t> Sandra's parents fifty grand a year for her to attend that school.
Finally, Poland ceased to <t>exist</t> as a state for hundreds of years.
The atomic bombings were probably not <t>necessary</t> to win WWII without a mainland invasion of Japan.
listRoleDefinitions: The entity whose scalar property is specified.
The <fen>Scale</fen> is the attribute of the <fen>Item</fen> that is being described.
This role identifies the <fen>Enabled_situation</fen> by which the critical value is judged.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> that an <fen>Agent</fen> starts.
This role identifies the being that starts the intentional <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> starts an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> starts an <fen>Activity</fen>.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is the item(s) whose price is being assessed.  <fen>Goods</fen> is usually an External Argument:
The person whose <fen>Asset</fen> is given up in order to achieve an <fen>Intended_event</fen>.  This role is often expressed as INI.
The price of or payment made for the Goods.
The event that the <fen>Payer</fen> brings about by deploying the <fen>Asset</fen>.
The time when a transaction takes place.
Some entity, abstract or concrete, which is stated to exist.
A time at which the entity is in existence.
Where the <fen>Entity</fen> exists.

This Frame Element marks expressions indicating the <fen>Activity</fen> that the <fen>Experiencer</fen> finds difficult or easy. In many cases, the relevant <fen>Activity</fen> has to be inferred from the context.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate which person judges carrying out the <fen>Activity</fen> to be easy or difficult.
The time at which the <fen>Activity</fen> takes place.
The state-of-affairs which cannot hold without the <fen>Requirement</fen>.
The entity or state-of-affairs that must be present or obtain in order for the <fen>Dependent</fen> to obtain.
An entity that has to be present for the <fen>Dependent</fen> state of affairs to obtain.
The time at which the <fen>Requirement</fen> is necessary for the <fen>Dependent</fen>.
<fen>Place</fen> denotes a location in which the specified relation between <fen>Requirement</fen> and <fen>Dependent</fen> holds.
listRoleExamples: It was <fex>hot</fex> enough to ignite the iron.
Can He make a rock too heavy <fex>for Him to lift</fex>?
A holiday in Europe is very expensive <fex>for me</fex>.
No, they've got a special on; it's really cheap there <fex>on Tuesdays</fex>
The geology question on the exam was hard <fex>for me</fex>.
<fex>In the US</fex>, the political clout of big city mayors is necessary to put this on the national agenda.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: WLR 475Section 20 of the Offences Against the Person Act 1861: DPP v Majewski
Crim LR 135Section 18 of the Offences Against the Person Act 1861: R v Brown
Criminal Injuries Compensation Authority v First-tier Tribunal
